questions.question: What is the chemical formula of KGF-1·H2O?
What method was used for crystal-structure determination of KGF-1·H2O?
What is the space group of KGF-1 after degassing?
How does the coordination number of Pb1 in KGF-1 change after removing water molecules by heating?
questions.answer: The coordination number of Pb1 in KGF-1 decreases from eight to six.

questions.question: What is the main difference between the structures of KGF-1·H2O and KGF-1?
questions.answer: The main difference is the presence of the coordinating water molecules in KGF-1·H2O.

questions.question: What technique was used to measure pseudo-photoconductivity in KGF-1·H2O?
What does the positive signal in the femtosecond transient absorption spectroscopy of KGF-1·H2O indicate?
questions.answer: The positive signal corresponds to a triplet (or free carrier) state.

questions.question: True or False: The overall structures of KGF-1·H2O and KGF-1 are significantly different.
True or False: The photocatalytic activity of KGF-1·H2O is lost after photoirradiation under photocatalytic reaction conditions.
What is the role of K2PtCl4 in the photocatalysis experiments with KGF-1·H2O?
questions.answer: K2PtCl4 acts as a precursor of the Pt cocatalyst.

questions.question: What is the significance of the low recombination yield observed in the initial stage of photoconduction in KGF-1·H2O?
questions.answer: The low recombination yield contributes positively to the initial stage of the photoconductivity of KGF-1·H2O.

questions.question: True or False: The crystal structure of KGF-1 remains rigid upon guest removal.
What does the φΣμmax value represent in the context of time-resolved microwave conductivity experiments?
questions.answer: The φΣμmax value represents the minimum hole and/or electron mobility of the sample in the absence of metal contact.

questions.question: What experimental setup was adapted for photocatalysis experiments with KGF-1·H2O?
questions.answer: The experimental setup was adapted from a previous report.

questions.question: True or False: The C–S bond lengths in KGF-1·H2O indicate that all of the C–S bonds in ttc3- are double bonds.
